page.pageNote: International news and report on social event celebrating William Penn's charter.
Speech of B. F. Wade in U.S. Senate, March 7, 1860 on disunion and slavery.

div.head: Must We Have An Aristocracy?
div.excerpt: No man in this country has an inherent right to trample upon the liberty of any other man--no matter how lowly or humble he be.

div.head: Pastor Elected
div.summary: Thomas L. Preston elected pastor at Presbyterian (Falling Spring) Church.

div.head: Removal
div.summary: A. J. White opens new store in town.

div.head: List of Causes for Trial
div.summary: Cases for court on April 9, 1860: Keystone Insurance Co. v. William McLellan; Wm. A. Lean & Co. v. Gorden & Hollinberger; Jeremiah C. George v. Emanuel Crosland; C. T. Maclay v. George W. Immel; Peter cook v. Samuel Thomson's Exec.; Daniel Dechert, Jr. v. George A. Corwell; John Reasoner v. C.C.Foltz; I. & S. Eley v. John & A. S. Senseny; Daniel Smetzer v. Jacob Bricker; John R. Clippinger v. Dr. J. L. Suesserott; Jacob Rinehard & Wife v. Jacob S. Brown et al; William Philippy v. Abraham Shetter; Shryock, Taylor & Smith v. William W. Sellers; George Naugle v. James S. Horner; Henry F. Davis v. Henry G. Funk; Mrs. Sarah Denig v. George Aston's Adm'r.; David Smith v. Wm. McLellan; Dandiel Guitner v. James and Wm. Huston; George Foust v. Christopher Laydig; Michael Strock v. Sechrist & Carbaugh; Michael Stickle & Wife v. John Strine; John Zimmerman v. P. D. Blair et al; Peter B. Housum v. Daniel Trostle; George W. Bitner v. Country of Franklin; Peter Reed v. Saumel Dysert; David Bemisdaffer v. Lweis Knode; David Gillan v. Wm. McGrath et al; Nickolas Uglow v. Samuel Wolfe; Margaret McNulty et al v. Jacob Garver et al; David R. Stougger v. McNeal & Strine; Issac Winger v. Solomon Helser.

div.summary: List of proprieters who need to petition for license renewal.

div.summary: List of proprietors of various businesses, by township and business type.
